part4_counterNarrativeStrategy.message: Counter-narrative playbooks can be generated on-demand when needed

responsibilities: Weekly performance review and adaptation decisions
roles.rationale: Minimal content load allows focus on strategic oversight

roles.outsourcingOptions: Fractional social media manager or VA with tech industry experience

responsibilities: Industry analyst and influencer relationship building
roles.why: Authentic relationship building requires internal team member

teamBandwidth.minimumTeamSize: 1-2 people (can be same person wearing multiple hats)
teamBandwidth.recommendedTeamSize: 2 people with clear role separation for scalability

essential.notes: Minimal tooling needed due to low content volume

optional.notes: Only if organic relationship building shows traction

core.purpose: Monitor narrative spread and stakeholder conversations
Track relationship progression and touchpoint history

monitoring.purpose: Track narrative ownership and indirect attribution
Monitor target stakeholder activity and engagement

monday: Plan week's relationship touchpoints and community engagement
tuesdayThursday: Execute relationship building activities (comments, shares, direct outreach)
Monitor and engage in industry conversations
Participate in relevant online communities and forums
friday: Weekly performance review using system-level metrics
Plan following week's activities based on stakeholder behavior signals
Update relationship tracking and identify new opportunities

convergenceScore.definition: How often target stakeholders encounter CodeX perspective from multiple independent sources within 7 days
measurement: Track 25 key stakeholders' LinkedIn activity weekly
Monitor: Do they engage with our content AND mention/share related content from others?
Survey 20 target prospects monthly: 'Where have you seen discussion about [campaign topic]?'
Target: 25% report 2+ sources by Week 8, 40% by Week 12
convergenceScore.why: CASCADE success requires stakeholders seeing consistent narrative from multiple angles

narrativeOwnership.definition: % of information environment we influence when stakeholders research CodeX/our domain
measurement: Google search 'CodeX' + related terms: count top 10 results we own/influenced
LinkedIn search for industry topics: % of posts in our narrative framework
Industry publication coverage: % using our framing vs competitor framing
Target: 50% of search results reflect our narrative by Week 10
narrativeOwnership.why: When prospects research us, they should find consistent positive narrative

indirectAttribution.definition: Industry voices adopting our perspective/language without direct attribution
measurement: Track: Analysts using our terminology in reports
Track: Competitors shifting messaging to address our narrative
Track: Industry discussions framing problems/solutions our way
Target: 3+ instances of indirect adoption by Week 12
indirectAttribution.why: Ultimate success is when our perspective becomes industry conventional wisdom

stakeholderBehaviorChange.definition: Target stakeholders taking desired actions beyond awareness
measurement: Primary: Website traffic from target accounts and demo requests
Tertiary: Speaking/panel invitations and media mentions
Target: 2x baseline engagement from target stakeholder list
stakeholderBehaviorChange.why: Narrative success must translate to business outcomes

metrics: Social media engagement rate (target: 5%+ on LinkedIn)
Influencer mention/tag rate (how often they reference us)
Reciprocal engagement (do they engage back when we engage?)
Event conversation quality (depth of post-event discussions)
Media relationship warmth (response rate to outreach)
Story placement quality (tier 1 vs tier 2/3 publications)
Message control (% of coverage using our framing)

adaptationStrategy.performanceReviewCadence: Weekly tactical review, bi-weekly strategic assessment

pivotTriggers.diagnosis: Narrative not spreading through network effects
adaptations: Audit message clarity and stakeholder relevance
Increase direct relationship building vs passive content

pivotTriggers.trigger: Relationship progression stalled (same people, no new advocates)
pivotTriggers.diagnosis: Network too insular or value proposition unclear
adaptations: Expand target stakeholder list to adjacent networks
Shift from thought leadership to direct value delivery
Increase event participation to meet new contacts
Partner with existing advocates to access their networks

pivotTriggers.trigger: High engagement but no behavior change by Week 8
pivotTriggers.diagnosis: Narrative resonates but lacks clear call to action
adaptations: Add specific next steps to all content
Shift from educational to problem-solving content

pivotTriggers.diagnosis: Our positioning vulnerable or narrative environment shifted
adaptations: Acknowledge competitor points while reinforcing our advantages
Shift to proof points and case studies vs theoretical positioning
Activate customer advocates for third-party validation
Focus on differentiation vs direct confrontation

ifBudgetConstrained: Focus entirely on organic relationship building and content engagement
Prioritize 1-2 highest-ROI events vs attending everything
Leverage free community platforms vs paid amplification
Use SignalDesk automation to maintain presence with minimal manual effort
ifTimeConstrained: Use SignalDesk for all content creation and scheduling
Focus on high-leverage activities: key relationships and tier 1 events
Automate social listening and only respond to high-priority mentions
Batch similar activities (all outreach on Tuesdays, all content on Wednesdays)

howToKnowWhenToProgress: Week 1-4: Foundation building - focus on relationship establishment and initial content
Week 5-8: Momentum building - stakeholders start referencing our content unprompted
Week 9-12: Narrative dominance - industry conversations happen in our framework
Success indicator: When stakeholders ask us to speak/participate vs us requesting

whatSignaldeskHandles: Social media content scheduling and posting
Industry conversation monitoring and alert generation
whatTeamExecutes: Event attendance and in-person relationship building

indicators: Initial social media engagement patterns identified
3+ stakeholders proactively engaging with our content

part6_patternGuidance.message: Pattern-specific guidance can be generated on-demand
